page.title: 16BROMBOROUGH POWER STATION.
page.content: Bromborough power station was built in 1946 by a company called monks ltd.It took 2-3 years to build and when it was finished it was bought by a company called C.E.G.B., wich means the central electricity generating board .This power station produced 200 killawatts an hour that means it produced 4800 killawatts a day.At least 200 people worked there and they worked on shifts of about 50 people at a time. Merseyside County Council is currently supervising the demolition of the main buildings, and the scrapping of the turbines. the site will be re-developed, and part may be given to EASTHAM COUNTRY PARK.
